article.headline: Butler 66, Lehigh 41
article.story: LARAMIE, Wyo. (AP) -- A.J. Graves and Avery Sheets scored 14 points apiece as Butler took advantage of Lehigh's offensive woes for a 66-41 win and fifth place in the Black Coaches Association Invitational Tuesday. Lehigh turned the ball over 19 times and shot just 25 percent from the floor in the first half. It narrowly avoided the team's worst scoring effort in coach Billy Taylor's four years. Lehigh scored just 39 points in a loss to Holy Cross on Jan. 31, 2003, during Taylor's first season at the Mountain Hawks helm. Butler (2-1) had few troubles from the start and opened up a 21-6 lead 12 minutes into the game and entered halftime with a 29-12 edge. Four different Bulldogs finished in double-figures. Bruce Horan and Brandon Polk each had 11 for Butler. Butler, which had just four turnovers, also shot 50 percent (10-of-20) from beyond the 3-point line. Lehigh, which made just five field goals in the first half, was led by Kyle Neptune's 11 points. Jose Olivero, who scored 25 points Monday, was held to just 8 points on 4-of-9 shooting.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
